se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.generator

Class AbstractFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.quickstart.api.generator.AbstractFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractComponentFactory, AbstractProjectFactory

    public abstract class AbstractFactory
extends Object
    Abstract utility implementations for all Factory classes, including POM synthesis and naming validation.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Detail

      • getNamingStrategy

        protected final NamingStrategy getNamingStrategy()
        Retrieves the active NamingStrategy used by this AbstractFactory.
        Returns:
        the active NamingStrategy used by this AbstractFactory.

      • getTemplateResourceURL

        protected abstract URL getTemplateResourceURL(String templateResourcePath)
        Method retrieving a URL to a template for the supplied templateResourcePath. Typically, this method should be implemented in a concrete Factory to emit valid JAR URLs for each resource type which should be synthesized by AbstractFactory subclasses. Only URLs with either 'jar' or 'file' protocols may be returned. (I.e. the template resource must either be packaged within a JAR or found within the local file system).
        Parameters:
        templateResourcePath - The path of the resource template for which a URL should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a URL to a template for the supplied resourceType. May only return URLs with either 'jar' or 'file' protocols.

      • getTemplateResource

        protected String getTemplateResource(String templateResourcePath)
        Retrieves a template resource data from the supplied templateResourcePath (relative to the Classpath).
        Parameters:
        templateResourcePath - The path to the template resource to synthesize. Fed to the getTemplateResourceURL method to retrieve the actual template URL.
        Returns:
        all data found in the resource template given by the relativeResourcePath (with token substitution performed if applicable).

      • getShouldTokenizeFilter

        protected FileFilter getShouldTokenizeFilter()
        Acquires a FileFilter which accepts Files whose content should be run through a TokenParser before returning. The default implementation simply retrieves the FileUtils.CHARACTER_DATAFILE_FILTER; override this method if your particular Factory requires a different implementation.
        Returns:
        A FileFiler which accepts Files whose content should be Tokenized.
